about.description: This is a tool for managing a recorded version number in setuptools-based python projects. The goal is to remove the tedious and error-prone "update the embedded version string" step from your release process. Making a new release should be as easy as recording a new tag in your version-control system, and maybe making new tarballs.
about.summary: Non-vendored versioneer in the spirit of PEP 518.

about.description: This is a tool for managing a recorded version number in setuptools-based python projects. The goal is to remove the tedious and error-prone "update the embedded version string" step from your release process. Making a new release should be as easy as recording a new tag in your version-control system, and maybe making new tarballs.
about.summary: Non-vendored versioneer in the spirit of PEP 518.

name: versioneer-518
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "versioneer-518" %}
{% set version = "0.19" %}


package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/versioneer-518-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: a287608997415f45401849d1227a42bb41b80a6e4a7da5776666f85ce6faec41

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python >=2.7
  run:
    - python >=2.7

test:
  imports:
    - versioneer
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - pip

about:
  home: https://github.com/python-versioneer/versioneer-518
  summary: Non-vendored versioneer in the spirit of PEP 518.
  license: NIST-PD
  license_file: LICENSE
  description: >
    This is a tool for managing a recorded version number in setuptools-based python projects. The goal is to remove the tedious and error-prone "update the embedded version string" step from your release process. Making a new release should be as easy as recording a new tag in your version-control system, and maybe making
    new tarballs.
  dev_url: https://github.com/python-versioneer/versioneer-518

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - Midnighter
    - bucknerns
